metadata.Title: CVE-2015-3395 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low
metadata.Description:
The msrle_decode_pal4 function in msrledec.c in Libav before 10.7 and 11.xbefore 11.4 and FFmpeg before 2.0.7, 2.2.x before 2.2.15, 2.4.x before2.4.8, 2.5.x before 2.5.6, and 2.6.x before 2.6.2 allows remote attackersto have unspecified impact via a crafted image, related to a pixel pointer,which triggers an out-of-bounds array access.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-3395` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu1.1218
chromium-browser-l10n - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu1.1218
chromium-chromedriver - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu1.1218
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu1.1218
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu1.1218
No subscription required

ffmpeg - 7:2.8.3-1
libavcodec-extra - 7:2.8.3-1
libavcodec-extra57 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavcodec57 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavdevice57 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavfilter-extra - 7:2.8.3-1
libavfilter-extra6 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavfilter6 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavformat57 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavresample3 - 7:2.8.3-1
libavutil55 - 7:2.8.3-1
libpostproc54 - 7:2.8.3-1
libswresample2 - 7:2.8.3-1
libswscale4 - 7:2.8.3-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '47.0.2526.73-0ubuntu1.1218').
ffmpeg package in esm-apps/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:2.8.3-1').
